Package fi.abo.kogni.soile2.projecthandling.projectElements.instance

Class ElementInstanceBase

java.lang.Object
fi.abo.kogni.soile2.projecthandling.projectElements.instance.ElementInstanceBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
ElementInstance
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExperimentObjectInstance, FilterObjectInstance, Randomizer, TaskObjectInstance
public abstract class ElementInstanceBase extends Object implements ElementInstance
This represents an instance of a Object as stored in the Underlying database. All Instances must implement a "nextTask()" method, that returns the ID of the next task that has to be run for a user.
Author:
Thomas Pfau

    • getInstanceID

      public String getInstanceID()
      Description copied from interface: ElementInstance
      Get the instance ID of this ElementInstance. This needs to be unique WITHIN its context (i.e. within the enclosing experiment AND the enclosing Project)
      Specified by:
      getInstanceID in interface ElementInstance
      Returns:
      the id of this instance

    • setInstanceID

      public void setInstanceID(String instanceID)
      Description copied from interface: ElementInstance
      Set the instance ID of this ElementInstance. This method does not check for uniqueness, but assumes this is unique within its context.
      Specified by:
      setInstanceID in interface ElementInstance
      Parameters:

    • nextTask

      public abstract io.vertx.core.Future<String> nextTask(Participant user)
      Description copied from interface: ElementInstance
      Return the ID of the next TaskObjectInstance for the given user based on the assumption, that the user has finished the task at its `getProjectPosition()`. This function needs to checkk what the next eligible Element Task the participant can use is (not necessarily "getNext")
      Specified by:
      nextTask in interface ElementInstance
      Parameters:
      user - the next element given the user (to retrieve the status
      Returns:
      A Future of the id of the next element

    • getNextIfThereIsOne

      protected io.vertx.core.Future<String> getNextIfThereIsOne(Participant user, String next)
      Checks, whether "next" is possible and if not return null.
      Parameters:
      user - The user for which to get the next element
      next - the next element.
      Returns:
      The instanceID of the next TaskObjectInstance or null if there is no next.
